meanings.definition: To program (a computer or other machine) again.
meanings.sent1: I will reprogramme the robot to move faster.
meanings.sent2: It is important to reprogramme the security system after an upgrade.
meanings.sent3: Why did the computer refuse to reprogramme itself? It must be tired of all the changes!
meanings.sent4: After the virus attack, the IT team had to reprogramme the entire network to ensure safety.
meanings.sent5: The scientist had to reprogramme the drone to follow a new flight path.

meanings.definition: To change or alter the programming of something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to reprogramme the settings on her phone for better performance.
meanings.sent2: The engineers had to reprogramme the software to fix the bug.
meanings.sent3: The toaster seemed to reprogramme itself to only burn toast on Mondays!
meanings.sent4: His experiences in the new city slowly began to reprogramme his way of thinking.
meanings.sent5: The artist had to reprogramme the digital painting to add more details.
